intro: Carex blepharicarpa f. dueensis, commonly known as the dueensis sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known for their distinctive inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often wind-pollinated. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
